Introduces the first crosslink (biaryl ether) between hpg4 and bht6 of the balhimycin precursor.
Introduces the second crosslink (biaryl ether).

Installs a biaryl ether bond on the balhiycin precursor. The reaction might be less specific than depicted in the reaction SMARTS. There is no detailed study on the specificity so far. The reaction occurs probably while the precursor peptide backbone is bound to the NRPS as shown for the closely related vancomycin biosynthesis (10.1002/ANIE.200461278).

The halogenase chlorinates the second bht residue of the balhimycin precursor, probably while the precursor is bound to module 6 of the NRPS. The PCP domain of module 6 might be required for the reaction. The substrate specificity of the enzyme might be less specific than represented in the SMARTS pattern. In order to make the specificity not too broad structures were rather kept in the pattern than left out.
KtzQ is a regiospecific halogenase that catalyzes the chlorination of L-Trp at C7 position to yield 7-chlorotryptophan
KtzR is a regiospecific halogenase that catalyzes chlorination at the 6-position of 7-Cl-L-Tryptophan to generate 6,7-diCl-L-Trp.

Adds N-acetylglucosamine or N-acylglucosamine to Hpg4 of the teicoplanin aglycone. Substrate specificity is probably more general than depicted in the reaction SMARTS, but there is no precise information on substrate specificity. In order to avoid making the reaction too general, the complete backbone is included in the pattern.

Glycosyltransferase adds N-acetylglucosamine to Bht6 of the teicoplanin precursor. Substrate specificity is probably more general than depicted in the reaction SMARTS, but there is no precise information on substrate specificity. In order to avoid making the reaction too general, the complete backbone is included in the pattern.
Deacetylates N-acetylglucosaminyl residue on Hpg4 of the teicoplanin precursor.
Deacetylates N-acetylglucosaminyl residue on Hpg4 of the teicoplanin precursor.
Transfers glucose onto hpg4 in the vancomycin and teicoplanin aglycone.

Introduces the second biaryl-ether crosslink between bht2 and hpg4 in the vancomycin and balhimycin precursor. The reaction occurs while the vancomycin precursor is bound to the PCP of module 6 or 7. The enzyme only accepts the chlorinated precursor.

Methylates the N-terminus of the vancomycin backbone. Substrate specificity not known in detail. SMARTS has been designed to be not too unspecific by accident. True substrate specificity might be broader than assumed here.

Chlorinates bht 2 and bht 6 of vancomycin. The bond to the PCP domain of module 2 of the vancomycin NRPS might be important for the reaction. There is no study on the substrate specificity for the second chlorination reaction in vancomycin biosynthesis on bht 6 so far.

Introduces the first biaryl-ether crosslink between hpg4 and bht6 in the vancomycin and balhimycin precursors. Reaction occurs while the backbone precursor is bound to the PCP domain of module 6 or 7. The link to the PCP domain is required for the reaction.
Transfers vancosamine onto glucose on hpg4 of vancomycin pseudoaglycone.

TdaE relies on its substrate as electron donor (rather than NAD(P)H) for O2 activation and covalent flavin-oxygen adduct formation.
